titles.title: National Security and Trade Act of 1987
A bill to strengthen provisions of the law that provide safeguards when imports threaten to impair the national security.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.
Committee on Finance. Hearings held. Hearings printed: S.Hrg. 100-171.

bill.summary: 2/4/1987--Introduced. National Security and Trade Act of 1987 - Amends the Trade Expansion Act of 1962 to require the President to take action within 90 days of receiving a report from the Secretary of Commerce that articles are being imported in such quantities, or under such circumstances, as to impair national security.
